headline: Sandisk Announces Launch of Secondary Offering of Common Stock
summary: MILPITAS, Calif., February 17, 2026--Sandisk Corporation (Nasdaq: SNDK) (the "Company" or "Sandisk") announced today the launch of a secondary public offering (the "Offering") of $3,085,774,648 of shares of its common stock (the "SNDK Shares") currently owned by Western Digital Corporation, the Company’s former parent ("WDC"). Sandisk is not selling any shares of common stock and will not receive any proceeds from the sale of the SNDK Shares in the Offering or from the debt-for-equity exchange (

headline: Can Seagate Sustain Double-Digit Revenue Growth Amid Competition?
summary: STX posts record Q2 revenues of $2.83B as data center demand surges, HAMR ramps and nearline capacity stays fully booked into 2026.

headline: Sandisk Rides NAND Shortage As AI Hyperscalers Lock In Supply
summary: Sandisk, NasdaqGS:SNDK, is emerging as a key independent supplier of NAND flash as the industry faces an extended supply shortage. The company reports sold out manufacturing capacity and increasing interest from AI focused data centers and device makers. Large cloud and AI infrastructure customers are locking in multi year NAND supply agreements with Sandisk. These developments are reshaping Sandisk’s role in the memory market following its spin off from Western Digital. Sandisk’s post spin...

headline: The Year's Five Best Stocks Already Have A Lot Of Memories
summary: Memory has become vital to the AI boom, sending shares of Sandisk, Seagate and Western Digital soaring in 2026 after sprinting in 2025.

headline: Western Digital’s AI Storage Shift Puts Hyperscaler Roadmap In Focus
summary: Western Digital is repositioning itself as an AI infrastructure provider, centered on new hard drive technologies and high capacity roadmaps. The company is pursuing a dual ePMR and HAMR approach, with plans for 40TB and future 100TB HDDs aimed at large cloud and AI customers. Multi year procurement agreements with major hyperscalers such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud are intended to secure demand for these drives. Western Digital (NasdaqGS:WDC) is now firmly tied to the build out of AI...
